title: Late Arrival
opening: Just to the north of Pherae territory stands Castle Araphen. The Lycia Alliance had gathered here to discuss the matters of going up against Bern. However, Roy and Guinevere were only half a day away from Castle Araphen, when a messenger brought them news that they could not believe. The message was this: "Bern has a trio of elite generals called the Three Dragon Lords. Two of these three, General Brunnya and General Narcian, have attacked Castle Araphen and nearly decimated the Lycia Alliance Army."
Although the morale of the Pherae Army went down severely, Roy led his group towards Castle Araphen to find survivors and check the damage.

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: Your Majesty, we have captured the enemy leader.

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: Good. Bring him before me.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: You... Zephiel, the King of Bern!!! Damn you...!

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: Ah, Lord Hector. I must praise your ability of putting up such a good fight against two of our Dragon Lords. I suppose they do not call you the leader of the Lycia Alliance for nothing. However, you were not good enough. Pray while you can, for you end here.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Why...?

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: Hm?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Bern and Lycia... We were always on good terms with each other. Even when you took the throne, we have always paid our respects towards Bern...

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: Respect? Don't be ridiculous. Lycia... no, this entire continent must go under my rule. That is the only way to liberate this world. I lack the time to be worrying about such trivial matters as respect.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: To liberate... this world? What do you mean...?

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: It is of no importance to you. You are going to die anyway. Someone! Take him away! Throw Lord Hector into the dungeon!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Yes, sir!

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: Your Majesty, I will now return to the Sacae Plains.

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: Yes, you may be on your way.

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: ... One thing before I leave, your Majesty. I beg your pardon, but I do not think that it is such a good idea to put too much trust into sinister people...

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: Do you mean Idunn?

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: Yes. Our soldiers call her the 'Dark Priestess' and do not approve of her presence. I understand she is a shaman of great powers, however...

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: Brunnya, do you not have faith in me?

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: ...! Yes, of course I do, your Majesty! I just thought that...

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: Then all you do is follow my orders. Understood?

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: ... Yes. I will do whatever his Majesty wishes.

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: 'Do you not have faith in me?' Dear, dear, the things I say sometimes...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: So Lord Hector is still alive?!

intro.speaker: Chad
intro.line: Yeah, that's for sure. I saw some of Bern's soldiers take him into the castle.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Chad, was it? Do you know the inside of Castle Araphen well?

intro.speaker: Chad
intro.line: I guess... Wait, are you guys planning on going in to save Lord Hector? I wouldn't try that if I were you. The bulk of Bern's forces are gone, but there are still a decent number of soldiers in the castle, you know? It would be suicide to try and charge them with your army.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Perhaps. But we can't afford to lose Lord Hector. And you said that their main forces are gone, right? Then there is a chance we could win.

intro.speaker: Chad
intro.line: I see... Then I guess I'll go along too. I can show you around the castle.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: What?! No, no, don't feel pressured! If you could just explain what the interior of the castle looks like...

intro.speaker: Chad
intro.line: I also want revenge against Bern. C'mon, let me go with you!

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: All right. Then I'll be counting on you.

intro.speaker: Chad
intro.line: Of course! Leave locked chests and doors to me!

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: ... Master Roy... I beg your forgiveness of my brother's doings... I didn't think he would invade Lycia so soon...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: My Lady, there's no point in dwelling over the past. Please do not blame yourself. Besides, Lycia is still intact. If we could get our leader, Lord Hector, out of harm's way, we can unite Lycia once again and fight! We must recapture Castle Araphen for all of our sakes... and for Lilina's sake...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Let's go!

battle.speaker: Lugh
battle.line: Thanks for taking care of the children, Reverend.

battle.speaker: Priest
battle.line: Of course. We of the Elimine Church will take good care of the orphans. And what will you do, Lugh?

battle.speaker: Lugh
battle.line: I'm going to stay here. I still have some things to do.

battle.speaker: Priest
battle.line: I see... Please do not stress yourself.

battle.speaker: Lugh
battle.line: Yes, thank you.

battle.speaker: Lugh
battle.line: Make sure you listen to what the priest says, okay?

battle.speaker: Boy
battle.line: Aren't you coming with us, Lugh?

battle.speaker: Lugh
battle.line: I'm going to wait for Chad, and then we'll catch up with you...

battle.speaker: Girl
battle.line: Yay! Chad's coming too?

battle.speaker: Lugh
battle.line: That's right.

battle.speaker: Boy
battle.line: Then I want Raigh to come too!

battle.speaker: Lugh
battle.line: Yeah... It would be great if Raigh came back and we could all go together, wouldn't it?

battle.speaker: Priest
battle.line: Children, we must be off.

battle.speaker: Boy
battle.line: See you later, Lugh.

battle.speaker: Girl
battle.line: Hurry and catch up, okay?

battle.speaker: Lugh
battle.line: Sure...

battle.speaker: Lugh
battle.line: Sorry... But I've chosen not to run anymore.

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Narcian! What is causing all that noise?

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Probably what's left of the enemy are trying to put up a fight in their last hope.

battle.speaker: Idunn
battle.line: Your Highness, should we use the Dragons?

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: No, I do not wish to put the Dark Priestess through any trouble. Do not worry, we can handle them by ourselves...

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Not this time, Idunn. Send the Dragons back to Bern, as we planned.

battle.speaker: Idunn
battle.line: Yes, if his Highness wishes it to be so.

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: I will be off to Bern soon as well. Narcian, I'm going to leave Lycia up to you.

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: ... What shall I do with the remaining forces of the Lycia Army?

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Kill all those that stand against us.

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: ... Does that include women and children?

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Of course. Annihilate them enough so that they would no longer even think about going against us.

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Leave that to me, sire. Hehehe...

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Hmph, I wonder what his Majesty sees in that Idunn girl. Well, I think I'll be going as well. Slater, I'm trusting this castle with you.

battle.speaker: Slater
battle.line: Are you leaving?

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Yes. One of the marquesses who turned against Lycia has a special gift for me. He says it's a girl from Etrurian nobility or something... Hehehe...

battle.speaker: Slater
battle.line: From Etruria? She must be very beautiful, then!

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Yes, the marquess tells me she's still young but very beautiful.

battle.speaker: Slater
battle.line: I would be looking forward to it if I were you, sir. Please be careful on your way there.

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: You be careful too, Slater. Don't you dare get defeated by these remainders of Lycia's army. If you do, I will personally tear you apart.

battle.speaker: Slater
battle.line: ... Have mercy, sir...!

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Hahahaha...!

recruit-visit.speaker: Lugh
recruit-visit.line: Excuse me! You're from the Lycian Army, right? Please let me fight with you! I don't have any useful information, but I can use a bit of magic! Please let me help you!

recruit-visit.speaker: Chad
recruit-visit.line: Lugh!? What are you doing here?

recruit-visit.speaker: Chad
recruit-visit.line: Oh... Where's everybody else? Are they all right?

recruit-visit.speaker: Lugh
recruit-visit.line: Yeah. The Elimine Church is going to take care of them for a while.

recruit-visit.speaker: Lugh
recruit-visit.line: I can use some magic! You know, when I borrowed the Fire spell from Father's room?

recruit-visit.speaker: Chad
recruit-visit.line: Lugh, don't force yourself. You can't hurt people, can you?

recruit-visit.speaker: Chad
recruit-visit.line: I'm going to avenge Father. Lugh, you should stay with the others.

recruit-visit.speaker: Lugh
recruit-visit.line: I'm not going to hide anymore! Everyone, everyone just disappears when I'm not looking! Father, you, even Lleu... I want to fight to protect the people that I care for. I want to protect and not be just protected!

recruit-visit.speaker: Chad
recruit-visit.line: Lugh... All right then, let's crush Bern as soon as possible and go meet everyone else!

visit.speaker: Village
visit.line: You're the remnants of the Lycian Army, right? Here, take this and go quickly. There are a bunch of Bern soldiers here. Bern may govern this whole area, but we're friends of Lycia!

boss.speaker: Slater
boss.line: I-I won't lose! If I don't win... ... Oh... No...!!!

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Master Roy! We have found Lord Hector in the dungeon level!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Really!? Is he all right?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: He's severely wounded...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Roy...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Lord Hector! What an awful wound...! We must treat it! Here, lean on my shoulder..

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: It's all right... I won't last much longer...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Lord Hector...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: I was taken by surprise... I never would have guessed that Bern had resurrected the Dragons...!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Dragons!?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Yes... The Dragons that we humans fought in the past...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: The Scouring? I have heard of it. A long time ago, two races that each had half of Elibe, the humans and the Dragons, fought over total control of the continent...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Right... the "Eight Heroes"... defeated the Dragons and led us humans... to... victory...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: How did Bern use the Dragons...?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: I... have no idea... But... the Dragons had control of what is now Bern in the past... and Hartmut, one of the Eight Heroes... is the founder of Bern... Perhaps... the reason... lies there...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Lord Hector!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Roy... Go to Ostia...! ... You must... lead what is left of the Lycia Alliance Army... instead of me...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Me...? But...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Don't worry... in Ostia... are weapons that... are effective against Dragons...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Weapons?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: I have already told this to Lilina... Please take care of her too... She... may seem strong... But she is still a child... Please... give... her support...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ... Yes, I will.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: ... Lilina... Just... one... more...... time...!!!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Lord Hector!
